milestones.title: Oldowan Stone Tools
milestones.description: Nyayanga site on the Homa Peninsula in Kenya, Earliest tool tech.

milestones.title: Acheulean Stone Tools
milestones.description: Oldest found in Kokiselei in Kenya, Konso-Gardula, Ethiopia, and Olduvai Gorge, Tanzania - more complex tools (handaxe)

milestones.title: Control of Fire (Secure)
milestones.description: Chesowanja near Lake Baringo, Koobi Fora, and Olorgesailie in Kenya, cooking, warmth, protection

milestones.title: Early Symbolic Behavior
milestones.description: Blombos Cave South Africa, Engravings, beads, ochre use

milestones.title: Oldest Dated Abstract Cave Art
milestones.description: Abstract images, along with figurative art found in Leang Karampuang cave, Sulawesi, Indonesia
milestones.url: Nature Magazine - Narrative cave art in Indonesia by 51,200 years ago

milestones.title: Sewing Needles
milestones.description: Denisova Cave, Siberian Federal District, Russia, Evidence for tailored clothing

milestones.title: Oldest Textile Fibers (Flax)
milestones.description: Dzudzuana Cave, Georgia, fiber manipulation

milestones.title: Early Sedentism
milestones.description: Shuqba Cave, in the Judaean Mountains of Mandatory Palestine, permanent settlements based on wild resources

milestones.title: Neolithic Revolution
milestones.description: Göbekli Tepe, Turkey, Shift to agriculture, sedentism

milestones.title: Agriculture - Fertile Crescent
milestones.description: Chogha Golan, Iran, and then the Zagros Mountains region, Iran, Iraq and Turkey, wheat, barley, lentils, peas, sheep, goats, cattle, pigs, earliest farming, earliest livestock domestication

milestones.title: Advanced Stone Tools
milestones.description: Development of more sophisticated stone tools including hand axes

milestones.title: Early Human Shelters
milestones.description: First evidence of constructed shelters by early humans

milestones.title: Early Symbolic Art
milestones.description: First evidence of symbolic art and decoration

milestones.title: Cave Paintings
milestones.description: Earliest known cave paintings in Europe

milestones.title: Advanced Tools
milestones.description: Development of specialized tools including needles and fish hooks

milestones.title: Early Agriculture
milestones.description: First evidence of organized farming and crop cultivation

milestones.title: First Settlements
milestones.description: Establishment of first permanent human settlements

milestones.title: Pottery Development
milestones.description: First widespread use of pottery for storage and cooking

milestones.title: Early Metallurgy
milestones.description: First use of copper and metal working

milestones.title: Early Writing
milestones.description: Development of first writing systems in Mesopotamia, including pictographs and early cuneiform

milestones.title: First Cities
milestones.description: Development of first major urban centers in Sumer, including Uruk and Ur

milestones.title: Early State Formation
milestones.description: First evidence of organized state structures in Egypt, including centralized administration

milestones.title: Pyramid Construction
milestones.description: Construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza begins, marking a pinnacle of ancient engineering

milestones.title: Early Philosophy
milestones.description: Development of early philosophical thought in multiple civilizations, including Mesopotamia and Egypt

milestones.title: Astronomical Observations
milestones.description: Systematic astronomical observations in Babylon, including star catalogs and planetary movements

milestones.title: Iron Age Begins
milestones.description: Widespread use of iron tools and weapons, revolutionizing agriculture and warfare

milestones.title: Alphabetic Writing
milestones.description: Development of alphabetic writing systems, leading to increased literacy

milestones.title: Greek Philosophy
milestones.description: Rise of systematic philosophical inquiry in Greece

milestones.title: Classical Science
milestones.description: Development of systematic scientific inquiry in Ancient Greece

milestones.title: Hellenistic Science
milestones.description: Advanced mathematical and scientific developments in Alexandria

milestones.title: Roman Engineering
milestones.description: Advanced Roman engineering and architecture begins, including aqueducts and roads

milestones.title: Roman Technology
milestones.description: Peak of Roman technological innovation, including concrete and advanced machinery

milestones.title: Indian Mathematics
milestones.description: Development of advanced mathematics in India, including the concept of zero

milestones.title: Islamic Golden Age
milestones.description: Major advances in science and mathematics in the Islamic world

milestones.title: Viking Exploration
milestones.description: Norse exploration of North America

milestones.title: Medieval Innovation
milestones.description: Technological innovations in medieval Europe

milestones.title: Printing Press
milestones.description: Invention of movable type printing

milestones.title: Age of Discovery
milestones.description: European maritime exploration begins

milestones.title: Scientific Revolution
milestones.description: Beginning of modern scientific method

milestones.title: Early Industrial
milestones.description: Early developments of industrial revolution

milestones.title: Industrial Revolution
milestones.description: Start of industrial revolution in Britain

milestones.title: Electricity, First battery, Voltaic Pile
milestones.description: The Voltaic Pile, the first battery, was invented by Italian scientist Alessandro Volta in 1800. He first described it in a letter to the London Royal Society on March 20, 1800

milestones.title: Darwin, Theory of Evolution
milestones.description: Charles Darwin's book, On the Origin of Species, Natural selection, common descent

milestones.title: Quantum Mechanics Foundations
milestones.description: Max Planck's 1900 work on black-body radiation, Niels Bohr, Describes micro-world laws

milestones.title: Einstein: General Relativity
milestones.description: Albert Einstein On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies, Reshaped space and time

milestones.title: Digital Computers
milestones.description: Konrad Zuse in Germany i1941 built world's first programmable computer, the Z3.

milestones.title: Transistor Invention
milestones.description: The first successful demonstration of a transistor occurred on December 23, 1947, at Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, New Jersey, USA, Miniaturization begins

milestones.title: Birth of Artificial Intelligence
milestones.description: AI is generally considered to have taken place at the Dartmouth workshop in 1956, organized by John McCarthy at Dartmouth College. Machine learning bases

milestones.title: Integrated Circuit (Microchip)
milestones.description: The first demonstrated integrated circuit (IC), or microchip, was developed by Jack Kilby at Texas Instruments in Dallas, TX, in 1958, Robert Noyce, Microprocessor precursor

milestones.title: Deep Learning Breakthroughs 1
milestones.description: in Ukraine USSR developed hierarchical representation of a neural network that uses polynomial activation function and are trained using the Group Method of Data Handling (GMDH). It is considered the first-ever multi-layer perceptron.

milestones.title: First working AI chatbot for public use
milestones.description: MIT Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, simulated conversations by using a pattern-recognition algorithm to compare user input to a set of rules and generate typewritten responses. It was named Eliza.

milestones.title: World Wide Web
milestones.description: Creation of the World Wide Web by Tim Berners-Lee at CERN

milestones.title: Digital Age
milestones.description: Widespread adoption of digital technology and the Internet

milestones.title: Mobile Revolution
milestones.description: Widespread adoption of mobile computing and smartphones

milestones.title: AI Revolution
milestones.description: Advanced AI and machine learning developments transform society

milestones.title: Deep Learning Breakthroughs 2
milestones.description: A convolutional neural network (CNN) designed by Alex Krizhevsky, published with Ilya Sutskever and Krizhevsky's PhD advisor Hinton

milestones.title: Generative AI Era
milestones.description: Open AI, San Francisco, California, Google, LLMs like GPT-4 and Gemini, Seatle, Washington

milestones.title: Early Towns - Jericho
milestones.description: Jericho, West Bank of Palestine, walls/tower

milestones.title: Agriculture - Mesoamerica
milestones.description: The Guilá Naquitz cave in Oaxaca, Mexico, domestication of squash, maize

milestones.title: Early Towns - Çatalhöyük
milestones.description: Çatalhöyük, Anatolia, Turkey, dense housing, art, communal living

milestones.title: Indus Valley Civilization, Harappan Civilization
milestones.description: Harappa, Advanced urban planning, sanitation

milestones.title: Agriculture - China
milestones.description: Hemudu region China, millet crop, Independent origin of rice/millet, beans

milestones.title: First Cities - Uruk
milestones.description: Eridu, Sumerians, Urban centers with temples

milestones.title: Wheeled Vehicles
milestones.description: Ljubljana, Broconcice Funnelbeaker Culture, Poland, Uruk also, revolutionized transport & trade
milestones.culture: Ljubljana wooden wheel, Broconcice pot, Uruk pictographs

milestones.title: Copper Smelting
milestones.description: Vnča-Belo Brdo, Serbia, earliest metal extraction

milestones.title: Potter's wheel
milestones.description: Veterba Cave, Cucuteni–Trypillia culture, Western Ukraine

milestones.title: Writing - Cuneiform
milestones.description: Ur, Iraq, proto-cuneiform tablet, evolved from tokens to literature

milestones.title: Iron Age Begins
milestones.description: Later widespread metal use

milestones.title: Writing - Hieroglyphs
milestones.description: Abydos, Egypt, Bone and ivory tags first oldest, developing later to Monumental religious writing

milestones.title: Bronze Age Begins
milestones.description: Sumerians living in regions around river Tigris and Euphrates convergence, in Al-Qurnah, Egyptians, Aegean Cultures, Stronger tools/weapons, stratification

milestones.title: Potter's Wheel
milestones.description: Ur, Iraq, revolutionized pottery production

milestones.title: Code of Hammurabi
milestones.description: Babylon, Iraq, Legal foundation (~1750 BCE)

milestones.title: Scientific Method
milestones.description: An Egyptian medical textbook, the Edwin Smith papyrus, (c. 1600 BCE) Aristotle (384 - 322 BC), Athens, Greece, observation and empirical evidence, Francis Bacon 1620 treatise, Novum Organum

milestones.title: Writing - Chinese Oracle Bones
milestones.description: Yinxu site, Henan province, China, divination system evolved into script

milestones.title: Babylonian Observational Astronomy and calendars
milestones.description: Babylon, Iraq, Observational astronomy and calendars

milestones.title: Axial Age Philosophies
milestones.description: Buddha, Zoroaster, Thales, Anaximander, and Heraclitus, Profound global philosophical shift

milestones.title: First Theoretical Science
milestones.description: Thales of Miletus, Greece, focused on explaining natural phenomena through reason and observation

milestones.title: Athenian Democracy
milestones.description: Pnyx hill in Athens, Greece, Cleisthenes, Pericles, Athenian Assembly, Ecclesia, Direct citizen participation

milestones.title: Greek philosophers
milestones.description: Athens, Greece, Socrates, Plato, Aristotle

milestones.title: Roman Twelve Tables
milestones.description: Foundational Roman law, publicly displayed in the Roman Forum

milestones.title: Roman Engineering - Aqueducts
milestones.description: The earliest Roman aqueduct, the Aqua Appia, Large-scale infrastructure feats

milestones.title: Writing - Maya Glyphs
milestones.description: San Bartolo, Guatemala, decoding history and ritual

milestones.title: Magnetic Compass Navigation
milestones.description: First invented -206, used for divination, described by Shen Kuo 1088, first maritime use logged by Zhu Yu in 1111, maritime navigation revolution

milestones.title: Paper Invention
milestones.description: Paper map depicting topographic features, Cai Lun refined it further, Transformed knowledge preservation

milestones.title: Roman Law - Justinian Code
milestones.description: Constantinople (Istanbul) Roman law, including Justinian's Code (Corpus Juris Civilis) Tribonian, Codification of Roman Law

milestones.title: Gunpowder
milestones.description: Searching for an elixir of life accidentally discovered gunpowder, fireworks → military revolution, later mining, construction.

milestones.title: Printing Press (Movable Type)
milestones.description: Yingshan, Hubei, China, Mass information dissemination

milestones.title: Renaissance
milestones.description: Dante Alighieri, Petrarch, Giotto De Bondone, and then it spread through Italian cities, and then through Europe

milestones.title: Age of Discovery Beginnings
milestones.description: Bartolomiu Dias reaching the Cape of Good Hope in 1488, Globalization and exchange

milestones.title: Scientific Revolution Begins
milestones.description: Nicolaus Copernicus's De revolutionibus orbium coelestium, Reshaped understanding of universe

milestones.title: Kepler - Planetary Motion
milestones.description: Kepler's laws of planetary motion, published in 1609, mathematical planetary orbits, stems from Tycho Brahe's work

milestones.title: Newton - Universal Gravitation
milestones.description: Newton Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica, classical physics foundation

milestones.title: First Steam Engine
milestones.description: Thomas Newcomen invented the first commercially successful steam engine, known as the Newcomen atmospheric engine, in 1712. It was developed in England.

milestones.title: First Industrial Revolution
milestones.description: Manchester, Liverpool, and Birmingham, arkwright, mechanization reshapes economies
